knimeNode.name: GIS Cluster
knimeNode.shortDescription: Performs clustering bases on geographical coordinates.

fullDescription.intro: This node performs a clustering based on geographical coordinates. The geographical coordinates can be acquired via the "Geocoding" node. Two clustering algorithms are supported: DBSCAN and k-means.
fullDescription.option: Algorithm used for clustering: DBSCAN (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DBSCAN) or k-means (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-means_clustering).
Allows to apply a filter to all stations. Only filtered stations are used for clustering.

option.name: DBSCAN -> Min Number of Points per Cluster

fullDescription.option: Minimum number of points needed for a cluster. Only available, if Cluster Algorithm is set to DBSCAN.
Maximum radius of the neighborhood to be considered. Only available, if Cluster Algorithm is set to DBSCAN.
The number of clusters to split the data into. Only available, if Cluster Algorithm is set to k-means.

ports.inPort: Input data table. Latitude must be in column "Latitude" and longitude in column "Longitude". Optional column "Clusterable" defines which rows should be clustered.
ports.outPort: Clustered data table. Cluster IDs are in column "ClusterID".
